did.unittitle: United States Fisheries Commission Archives

repository.corpname: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History

did.abstract: U.S. Fish Commission archives generated during A.E. Verrill's involvement with the Commission from 1871-1887.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: United States Fisheries Commission Archives, Invertebrate Zoology, Yale Peabody Museum

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The United States Fisheries Commission (USFC) was a government program which began in 1871 to investigate potential fisheries and marine faunal areas. Addison Verrill was involved as head scientist from 1871 to 1887 and much of his research is based on this material. Much of the Division of Invertebrate Zoology is made up of these collections and a majority are lots that were split between the Smithsonian's National Museum of Natural History (USNM) and the Yale Peobody Museum (YPM). Much of thes archives were generated by assistants to Verrill.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Material
scopecontent.p: These archives include original station notebooks and distribution sheets. The distribution sheets contain information on how the specimen lots were divided up between the USNM and YPM.

did.unittitle: Station Notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are the original station notebooks compiled by an observer while on board the vessels.

did.unittitle: USFC Stmr. Bluelight. Station notebooks for the USFC Stmr. Bluelight.

Distribution Sheets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These are the specimen distribution sheets compiled during an audit in 1907. It lists all lots and which institutions they were distributed to.

Verrill Retained Collections

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Catalogs of specimens collected by the USFC and retained by A.E. Verrill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous lists of USFC specimens, either retained by the YPM or returned to the USNM.
